Selecting a game engine

03 Mar 2014

As a side project i will try to do a game, i have not been doing anything like this since school in the Computer graphics course.

My main aim was to create a 2D sprites game to deploy on different platforms.

I went through the list below with gaming engines.

I looked through, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_game_engines, and http://www.moddb.com/engines/top, checked:

  • https://unity3d.com/

  • http://www.unrealengine.com/udk/downloads/

  • http://www.garagegames.com/products/torque-3d/licensing

Engine Pros Cons
Unity Uses .NET as scripting languge The free version might be limiting, can be to expensive to use the license after a while. See more here: [http://www.moddb.com/engines/unity/reviews](http://www.moddb.com/engines/unity/reviews)
Unreal Free To big for my purpose
Torque-3D/2D To be evaluated To be evaluated
